column6: how many servings current recipe makes
column23: Directions

>1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees >2. unroll pizza dough onto a packing sheet and pat into a rectangle >3. Bake crust at 400 degrees for 8 minutes >4. remove crust from oven and brush with olive oil >5. Arrange tomato slices on the crust >6. Sprinkle crust evenly with cheese > 7. Bake crust at 400 degrees for 12 minutes until cheese melts and crust is golden > 8. Sprinkle pizza with basil salt and pepper

>1. Combine cilantro. salt. egg whites. and eggs in a medium bowl and stir them with a whisk > 2. Add beans. onions. cheese. and salsa in another bowl >3. heat a frying pan over medium heat > 4. Pour egg mixture into pan > 5. Cook for 3 minutes >6. flip omlete >7. Put bean mixture on one half of the omlete and fold omlete in half >8. Cook 1 more minute until the cheese melts >9. slide omlete onto plate

>1. Heat the oil in put over medium heat >2. Add onions. bell peppers. and garlic and saute >3. Add cumin tomatos. chili powder and black beans >4. Bring pot to a boil >5. Reduce heat and allow chilli to simmer for 30 mins

>1. Preheat oven to 424 degrees >2. Line a baking sheet with foil and drizzle olive oil over the foil >3. Place the baking sheet in the oven >4. Flatten chicken breasts so they are about ¼ of an inch thick >5. Season chicken with salt and pepper >6. Mix flour and paprika together on a large plate >7. Beat eggs >8. add salt and pepper to egg mixture >9. Mix bread crumps and lemon juice together on a seperate large plate >10. Dredge each chicken piece in the flour mixture. then the egg mixture. then the bread crumb mixture before putting it on a seperate plate >11. Take baking sheet out of the oven and arrange chicken on it in 1 layer >12. Drizzle olive oil over each piece of coated chicken >13. Bake chicken in the oven for 5-6 min >14. Flip chicken and then cooking for 5-6 min more

>1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees >2. Put pie crust in packing pan and bake according to the directions >3.Brown the ground beef in a large pan over medium heat >4. Add taco seasoning to the meat and stir together >5. When pie crust is done cooking. take it out of the oven and place meat on top of it  >6. Layer with sour cream and cheese. >7. Put a layer of chips on the top >8. Return pie crust to the oven and let it bake for 10 min

>1. Bring a large pot of water to a boil >2.Cook pasta in boiling water until it is soft and then drain the water >3.Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium high heat >4.Add onion and garlic to the skillet and cook them until the onions are brown >5.Mix tomatoes mushrooms and spinach into the onion mixture >6.Season the onion mixture with salt pepper and red pepper flakes >7.Cook the onion mixture for 2 more minutes until tomatoes are heated through and spinach is wilted >8.Reduce heat to medium and stir in pasta and feta cheese >9.Cook pasta until it is heated through

>1. Preheat the oven to 300 degree and set the oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source >2. Season the salmon with salt and pepper before arranging it on a pan >3.Whish together the brown sugar and dijon mustard in a small bowl >4. Spoon the brown sugar evenly on top of the salmon fillets >5. Cook the fish under the broiler for about 10-15 minutes until the fish flakes easily with a fork

>1. Preheat skillet over medium heat >2. Generously butter one slice of bread >3. Place bread butter side down on skillet and add one slice of cheese >4. Butter second slide of bread on one side and place it butter side up on top of the sandwich >5.Grill the sandwich lightly until it is browned and then flip it

column14: heads of broccli cut into florets
column23: >1. In large bowl. blend cornstarch. garlic. and 1 tablespoon vegetable oil until cornstarch is dissolved >2. Mix in broccoli. carrots.and green beans. Toss them until they are lightly coated in the sauce >3. Heat remaining 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil in a large skillet >4. Cook vegetables in oil for 2 minutes >5. Stir in soy sauce and water >6. Mix in onions and salt >7. Cook until vegetables are tender but still crisp

>1. Heat olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat >2. Saute garlic in oil for 2-3 minutes and stir >3. Stir condensed tomato soup and marinara sauce into garlic >4. Slowly add water>5.Mix oregano and black pepper into soup >6. Bring soup to a simmer and then return the heat from high to low >7.Cook soup for 15 more minutes >8.Stir basil into soup >9.Ladle soup into bowls and top with croutons and Parmesan cheese
>1. Follow directions for noodle packet to make noodles >2. Add bok choy and simmer for 2 minutes >3. Add oil and sauce. Serve

column16: sheet frozen puff pastery dough; thawed
column23: >1. Pulse nuts and garlic in a mini food processor until finely chopped >2. Add cheese >3. Tear leaves off basil and add to processor >4. Process until paste-like >5. Roll dough into 10 by 9 rectangle. Spread pesto over dough and sprinkle with salt >6. Roll up the long sides of the dough until they meet in the middle. Place in freezer for 10 minutes >7. Cut dough cross wise into 20 slices. Arrange on a cookie sheet and bake at 400o for 16 minutes

column12: Cavolo Nero leaf; leaves chopped finely
column23: >1. Empty mince into mixing bowl. Add garlic and chopped Cavolo Nero leaf >2. Add salt and mix well >3. Heat coconut oil in a frying pan and form the mixture into balls. Drop them in the ban for 5-10 minutes >4. Place the meatballs in the oven at 400o for 10-15 minutes

column20: red pepper flakes; salt and pepper to taste
column23: >1. Pour salsa into slow cooker and layer beans and chicken on top >2. Cook on high for three hours >3. After 3 hours. remove chicken from slow cooker and shred with forks. Place back into slow cooker. >4. Add spices and cheese and mix to combine

>1. Melt half of the butter in a small frying pan. then add garlic >2. When fragrant. add flour and stir to combine. Add white wine >3. Turn down heat to let alcohol cook off >4. Turn heat back up and add lemon juice and remaining butter >5. Stir to combine and serve over pasta. with capers

>1. Bake the potatoes for 1 hour at 400o. Mash the potatoes >2. Combine mashed potatoes with egg and flour until dough is formed >3. Shape gnocchi. use a fork to give a slight indentation >4. Cook in boiling water. They are done when they float to the top.

>1. Beat the eggs >2. Add oil to a hot nonstick pan >3. Pour in eggs and quickly mix in tortilla chips >4. Stir in cheese and lower heat. cook for 3-4 minutes >5.Remove from pan and drizzle with hot sauce
>1. Chop the watermelon and mint into small pieces >2. Place watermelon and mint in a bowl of arugula and mix to combine >3. Top with feta

>1. Preheat oven to 400o >2. Scrub beets. wrap in aluminum foil. and roast on a baking sheet for an hour. Cut into quarters >3. Separate stems from greens. Wash and dry both >4. Sautee onion in olive oil in a medium pan. add beet stems and cook for 5 minutes >5. Add greens and seasoning to taste. cook until greens are mostly wilted >6. Add cooked grains and roasted beets to the pan. toss to combine >7. Transfer into a bowl and top with crumbled cheese

>1. Cook the rice >2. Cube tofu into 1-inch squares >3. Cook vegetables until tender >4. Heat dressing in a skillet. Add vegetables and tofu and mix to combine. Cook 3-4 minutes >5. Place rice in a bowl. Scoop mixture on top to serve

>1. Beat egg >2. In a separate bowl. mix quinoa and cheese. Pour in egg and mix >3. Add flour. salt. and pepper. and stir to combine >4. Add oil to a skillet and heat >5. Create small balls of mixture and slightly flatten. Place fritters into pan >6. Cook fritters for 5 minutes on each side >7. Allow to cool slightly on paper towel

>1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Coat baking sheet with nonstick cooking spray. >2. Pound chicken breasts to 1/4 inch thickness >3/ Sprinkle each piece of chicken on both sides with salt and pepper. Place 1 cheese clice and 1 ham slice on top of each breast. Roll up each breast and secure with a toothpick. Place in baking dish and sprinkle chicken evenly with breadcrumbs. >4. Bake 30-35 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink. Remove from oven and place 1/2 cheese slice on top of each breast. Return to oven for 3-5 minutes or until cheese has melted. Remove toothpicks and serve immediately

>1. Toast walnuts in a skillet over medium heat. Cook and stir until browned and fragrant. Remove from skillet. >2. Fill a pot with lightly salted water and ring to a rolling boil. Stir in ravioli and return to a boil. Cook uncovered and stir occasionally until the ravioli float to the top and the filling is hot. Drain. >3. Warm butter in a skillet over medium heat until slightly brown. Add balsamic vinegar. Cook and stir until melted and combined. Stir in ravioloi and mix until combined. Top with walnuts and Parmesean cheese.

column10: tablespoons chipotle peppers in adobo sauce
column23: >1. Mix chorizo and chipotle peppers in adobo sauce together in a bowl >2. Heat a skillet over medium high heat. Add chorizo mixture and cook until crisp. Transfer chorizo to a plate and reserve the grease in the skillet >3. Heat tortillas in the reserved grease in skillet over medium heat until warmed. Stack 2 tortillas on top of each other for each taco. Fill with chorizo onion and and cilantro

>1. Chop vegetables >2. Combine chopped vegetables in a medium bowl. Add vinaigrette and toss to coat >3. Refrigerate covered until serving. Stir in cheese just before serving. Serve with a slotted spoon

>1. Cook pasta according to package directions and add chopped broccoli during the last 2 minutes of cooking. Drain and rinse in cold water >2. Transfer to a large bowl. Add tomatoes olives salt and pepper. Drizzle with salad dressing and toss to coat. Chill until serving
>1. Place ingredients in a bowl and toss to combine >2. Refigerate covered for about an hour
>1. Chop fruit to desired size >2. Combine cubed melon and corn syrup. Cover and refrigerate overnight. >3. Stir in remaining fruit just before serving

>1. Scrub beets and trim tops to 1 inch. Place in a single layer on a mircowave safe dish. Drizzle with water. Microwave covered on high 10-15 minutes or until easily pierced with a fork. Turn once. Let stand 5 minutes. >2. Peel and cut beets into 3/4 inch pieces when they are cool >3. Combine vinegar oil salt and pepper in a bowl. Add olives beets and half of the mint. Toss to coat. >4. Refrigerate covered for at least an hour and then top with remaining mint

>1. Blend yeast and bread crumbs in a bowl >2. Form risotto balls and dregde them with the crumbs. (Optional: allow balls to chill in the fridge for a half hour) >3. Heat oil in a pot on high for 2 minutes and then turn to medium heat. Place balls in oil for 2-3 minutes and turn them to evenly fry all sides >4. Remove balls with a slotted spoon and place on a paper towel lines plate. Serve immediately.

column8: 12 oz package well pressed black soybean tofu
column23: >1. Slice tofu into cubes of desired size >2. Mix soy sauce sesame oil black pepper garlic powder and lemon juice. Add tofu. Put in fridge for an hour >3. Preheat oven to 350 >4. Spread tofu on a foil lined baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes. Flip each piece >5. Cover with remaining soy sauce mix and bake for another 20 minutes >6. Mix mayo and chili powder as a dipping sauce. Chill until ready to serve. >7. Put 1-2 cubes of tofu on toothpicks and serve

>1. Place sausage and mushrooms in a panini press. Cook for 2 minutes. >2. Warm a tortilla in panini press. Add cheese mushrooms and sausage and add hot sauce. >3. Add another tortilla. Keep layering as much as you want. Place slaw in last layer. >4. Cook about 2 minutes. >5. Slice and serve

>1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees >2. Slice baguette diagonally into 16 slices and brush both sides of each slice with olive oil. >3. Back baguette slides on a baking sheet for 8 minutes. >4. Half avocados and remove pit. Place flesh into a small bowl and mash with lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper. >5. Spread onto bread. Top with grape tomaotes
>1. Place all ingredients except paprika and parsley in a food processor and process until smooth. >2. Spoon hummus into bowl and sprinkle paprika and parsely on top

>1. Place eggs in a large saucepan. Cover with water to 1 inch above eggs and bring to a boil. Remove from heat. Cover and let stand 15 minutes. Drain and rinse with cold running water. >2. Peel eggs and cut in half lengthwise. Remove yolks. >3. Place yolks in a bowl and mash with a fork. Stir in mayo mustard lemon juice and pepper. >4. Spoon yolk mixture into egg white halves and sprinkle with chives and paprika

>1. Preheat oven to 350 >2. Remove leaves of kale from thick stems and tear into bite size pieces. Wash and dry. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt. >3. Place on lined cookie sheet and bake for 10-15 minutes

>1. Preheat oven to 450 degrees. >2. Wrap one slice of proscuitto around each asparagus spear starting at the bottom and spiraling up to the top. Place the wrapped spears on a lined baking sheet. >3. Bake for 5 minutes. Remove and roll spears over. Bake for another 5 minutes and serve immediately.
>1. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium low heat. Cook garlic and onion for 5 minutes >2. Stir in spinach. Stir in garbanzo beans and spices. >3. Lightly mash beans as mixture cooks.
>1. Presoak the lentils in water for at least 2 hours or overnight. Drain and discard water. >2. Stir together lentils with all ingredients in a crock pot. Cook on medium heat for 8-10 hours.

>1. Heat oil in a large stockpot over medium heat. Add onions and celery. Add dressing and cook 5-8 minutes. >2. Add broth and tomatoes and tomato paste. Add 3 cups of water and bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer and cook uncovered for 20 minutes. >3. Add vegetables and return to simmer. Cook uncovered for 20-25 minutes

column10: pounds peeled and chopped russet potatoes
column23: >1. Combine all ingredients in a large pot with 4 quarts of water. >2. Bring to a boil over high heat. Cover partially and simmer for 45 minutes. Stir occasionally.

>1. Heat oil and water over medium high heat in a large pot. Add onions and cook for 5 minutes. >2. Add sage and squash and cook for a few minutes. Add lentils and broth. Season with salt and pepper. Bring to a boil. Cover and reduce heat to low to simmer for 30 minutes. >3. Puree soup

>1. Half put and peel avocados >2. Blend buttermilk and yogury with half the avocados and dill. Add mint and garlic. Add chile and blend until smooth. >3. Pour soup into a large bowl and chill for 30 minutes. Cut the remaining avocado into small cubes. >4. Ladle soup into bowls. Place tufts of radishes and small spoonfuls of diced avocado in the center of each bowl to garnish

>1. Set aside one of the zucchinis. Trim and coarsely chop the rest. >2. Cook onion in a large saucepan for 5 minutes. Add garlic and cook for 1 more minute. Stir in chopped zucchini with salt and pepper and cook over medium heat for 5 minutes. >3. Add broth and simmer for 15 minutes >4. Pour into a blender and add basil. Add cashews and yeast and blend until smooth. >4. Return soup the pot and season with salt and pepper. Shred remaining zucchini with a spiral slicer. Pour soup into bowls and garnish with zucchini.

>1. Stir eggplants and tomatoes together in a slow cooker. >2. Warm 1 tbsp oil in a skillet over medium heat. >3. Add peppers and onions to skillet and cook for 3 minutes. >4. Stir in garlic and crushed red pepper. >5. Stir in salt and continue cooking until garlic is tender. >6. Stir vegetables into the eggplant mixture. >7. Remove items from slow cooker. >8. Warm remaining oil. >9. Add sausage and cook for 4 minutes >10. Place sausage above vegetables in slow cooker. >11. Cover the slow cooker and let it cook for 4-5 hours. >12. Season with salt and pepper before serving

>1. Add finely chopped onions to a greased pot over medium heat and cook 3-5 minutes. >2. Add minced garlic and curry powder. Add garam masala and cook for another minute. Stir in pumpkin puree. Add sweetner and veggie broth. Add almond milk and stir until combined. >3. Bring the soup to a boil for 1 minute and then reduce to a simmer for at least 20 minutes and up to an hour. The soup gets richer the longer it cooks. Puree using an immersion blender

>1. Heat a tablespoon of olive oil in a medium poit. Add the onion and garlic and cook over a medium heat. >2. Continue to cook the onion and garlic for 10-12 minutes. Stir occasionally. Add cauliflower and rosemary. >3. Turn the heat up and cook the vegetables for 3-5 minutes. Add just enough vegetable broth the cover the cauliflower. Bring to a boil and reduce the heat so that the broth is simmering. >4. Remove the soup from the heat after 5 minutes and blend until smooth

>1. Combine carrots and chicken stock in a dutch oven. Add 2 cups of water and leeks. >2. Cook dutch oven on the stove until the mixture boils. >3. Partially cover the mixture and reduce the heat. Simmer for 30 minutes. >4. Remove pan from heat and let stand for 10 minutes. >5. Place carrot mixture into a blender until smooth >6. Stir in vinegar and nutmeg. Add salt and pepper. >7. Combine 1 teaspoon of water with sour cream and chives in a separate bowl. >8. Ladle soup into bowl with about 1 cup of soup in each bowl. >9. Top each serving with 1 teaspoon of sour cream mixture

>1. Preheat oven to 425. >2. Toss broccoli stems and cauliflow in olive oil. Season with salt and pepper. >3. Place mixture on sheet pan and roast in oven for 18 minutes. >4. Toss with vinegar and chives.

column1: Orange Beat and White Bean Salad
column23: >1. Wrap beets in microwave safe parchment paper. Microwave on high for 12 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes. >2. Peel orange and cut into segments. Combine chopped beets with orange segments and cannellini beans on a small platter. Sprinkle evenly with cilantro and vinegar

>1. Combine the lemon juice with olive oil and honey in a jar. Add garlic and shake vigorously to make the dressing. >2. Place the kale in a bowl and add 2 tablespoons dressing. >3. Add carrots then cabbage and red onion to salad. >4. Add a couple tablespoons of dressing to the salad.
>1. Combine oil with lemon juice and mustard in a large bowl. Season with salt and pepper. >2. Add beans and onion. Toss well to combine. >3. Add arugala and toss gently
>1. Tear spinach leaves into bite sized pieces >2. Toss spinach with bacon onions and mushrooms. >3. Top salad with chopped eggs and dust with paprika.

>1. Place beets in a microwave safe bowl and add enough water to come halfway up the sides of the bowl. Cover with plastic wrap and vent. Microwave on high for 8 minutes then drain and cool. Peel and slice into wedges. >2. Combine arugala and orange cinaigrette. Toss gently to coat. >3. Arrange arugala mixture evenly onto plates. Top evenly with beef beets cheese and nuts
